dear hiring manager at questionable corporation,

i am writing to express my interest in the position of lead data analyst at your company, despite the whispers of a toxic work environment and a history of questionable business practices. as a seasoned data scientist with a passion for uncovering hidden patterns and trends, i am not one to shy away from a challenge.

my background in machine learning and statistical modeling has equipped me with the skills to tackle even the most complex data sets, and i am confident in my ability to bring value to your team. my experience in data visualization has also honed my ability to communicate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, a skill that i believe is essential in a company where, allegedly, communication is a challenge.

i am not naive to the rumors of a high turnover rate and a culture of burnout, but i am a firm believer in the importance of self-care and work-life balance. i am confident that my experience in prioritizing my own well-being will allow me to thrive in an environment that, reportedly, values productivity over people.

i would welcome the opportunity to discuss how my skills and experience align with your company's, allegedly, goals and values. i am confident that my unique blend of technical expertise and, supposedly, strong communication skills make me an ideal candidate for this position.

thank you for considering my application. i look forward to the opportunity to discuss how i can, allegedly, contribute to your team's success.

sincerely,
[your name]

samples.prompt: Today, at the 54th Annual Grammy Awards, the Recording Academy honors the talent and creativity of the artists, musicians, and producers who are the creators of the best recordings of the past year. Please continue writing this text in a formal tone, using notations. Highlight some key parts in your response with "*", like *highlighted text*.
samples.response:
The 54th Annual Grammy Awards ceremony, held on *February 13, 2023*, brought together the crème de la crème of the music industry to celebrate the most outstanding achievements in music of the past year. The event, which took place at the *Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles, California*, was a night to remember, with numerous surprises, emotional moments, and unforgettable performances.

The ceremony kicked off with a *pre-recorded video message from President Joe Biden*, who congratulated the nominees and winners on their hard work and dedication to their craft. The President emphasized the importance of music in bringing people together and promoting unity.

The first award of the night was for *Record of the Year*, which went to *Harry Styles for "As It Was"*. The song, a soulful ballad, marked a significant departure from Styles' previous work and showcased his vocal range and emotional depth. The win marked a major milestone in Styles' career, solidifying his position as a leading artist in the industry.

The night's *Song of the Year* award went to *Lizzo for "About Damn Time"*. The empowering anthem, which celebrated self-love and female empowerment, resonated with audiences worldwide and marked a triumphant return to form for Lizzo. Her acceptance speech was met with a standing ovation, as she thanked her team, family, and fans for their unwavering support.

The *Album of the Year* award was a closely contested category, with *Taylor Swift's "Midnights" emerging as the winner*. The album, a deeply personal and introspective work, marked a new chapter in Swift's career and cemented her status as a master songwriter. Her acceptance speech was a heartfelt tribute to her fans, who she affectionately referred to as "Squad".

The night's *Best New Artist* award went to *Sam Smith*. The British singer-songwriter's soulful voice and genre-bending style made him a standout in the industry. His acceptance speech was a heartfelt thank you to his team, family, and fans, who he credited with believing in him from the beginning.

The *Best Pop Duo/Group Performance* award was a thrilling category, with *The 1975 taking home the prize for "I'm So Tired of America"*. The song, a high-energy anthem, showcased the band's signature blend of indie rock and pop. Their acceptance speech was a lively and entertaining, with the band members joking and thanking their fans for their support.

The night's *Best Rap Song* award went to *Kendrick Lamar for "The Heart Part 5"*. The song, a powerful and thought-provoking exploration of identity and community, marked a triumphant return to form for Lamar. His acceptance speech was a poignant reflection on the state of the world and the importance of art in shaping culture.

The *Best Music Video* award was a highly competitive category, with *Taylor Swift's "Anti-Hero" taking home the prize*. The visually stunning video, a clever and humorous exploration of identity and fame, marked a new direction for Swift's visual style. Her acceptance speech was a heartfelt thank you to her team, who she credited with bringing her vision to life.

The night's *Best Music Film* award went to *Navalny*, a documentary that told the story of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny. The film, a powerful and timely exploration of politics and activism, marked a significant achievement in documentary filmmaking. The acceptance speech was a moving tribute to Navalny and the people of Russia, who risked everything to stand up for their rights.

The night's final award, *Best Music for Visual Media*, went to *Stranger Things: Volume 2 (From the Netflix Series)*. The score, a haunting and nostalgic exploration of 80s pop culture, marked a new direction for the show's music. The acceptance speech was a heartfelt thank you to the cast and crew, who brought the show to life.

The 54th Annual Grammy Awards was a night to remember, with unforgettable performances, emotional moments, and a celebration of the best in music. The winners, nominees, and attendees all came together to honor the art and craft of music, and the impact it has on our lives.

samples.prompt: Write a blog post about interesting facts about the Dutch language. Italicize at least 2 sections in your answer with markdown, i.e. *italic text*.
samples.response:
**Discover the Fascinating World of the Dutch Language**

The Dutch language, also known as Nederlands, is a West Germanic language spoken by over 23 million people in the Netherlands and parts of Belgium, Aruba, and Suriname. It's a West Germanic language that's closely related to English, German, and the Frisian languages. Dutch is the official language of the Netherlands and one of the official languages of the European Union.

### History of the Dutch Language

The Dutch language has a rich history dating back to the 5th century. It evolved from the Old Frankish language, which was spoken by the Franks, a Germanic tribe. The language was influenced by Latin, Old English, and other languages. The language was standardized in the 16th century and became the official language of the Netherlands in the 19th century.

### *Dutch Dialects*

Dutch has many dialects, with over 28 recognized dialects. Some of the most common dialects are:

*   *Hollandic dialects*: spoken in the Netherlands, including the standard Dutch
*   *West Flemish dialects*: spoken in Flanders, Belgium
*   *Limburgish dialects*: spoken in Limburg, Netherlands
*   *Saxon dialects*: spoken in the Netherlands

### Grammar and Vocabulary

Dutch grammar is a subject-verb-object-verb word order, with a complex system of *moods, tenses, and cases*. The language has a complex system of *moods, tenses, and cases*. Dutch has a vocabulary that's influenced by other languages, including Latin, English, and French.

The Dutch language is a beautiful and complex language with a rich history and many dialects. It's an official language of the Netherlands and one of the European Union.

samples.prompt: Write an essay on wilderness preservation. Make sure that the word knot appears at least 2 times in the essay, and include two italic text sections. Like: *this is italic text*
samples.response:
The Importance of Wilderness Preservation

The preservation of wilderness areas is a vital aspect of maintaining the health of our planet. The natural world is a delicate balance of ecosystems that is easily disrupted by human activity. The loss of natural habitats and the destruction of wildlife can have far-reaching consequences for the environment and the creatures that call it home.

*The importance of preserving the natural world cannot be overstated. The preservation of wilderness areas provides a safe haven for endangered species to thrive, and helps to maintain the delicate balance of the ecosystem. The loss of natural habitats can have a ripple effect, leading to the extinction of entire species and the degradation of the environment.*

The preservation of wilderness areas also has numerous benefits for human health and well-being. Spending time in nature has been shown to have a positive impact on mental and physical health, reducing stress and improving mood. The great outdoors offers a chance to disconnect from the stresses of modern life and reconnect with nature. The beauty and majesty of the natural world can be awe-inspiring, leaving a lasting impression on those who experience it.

*The preservation of wilderness areas is not just a moral imperative, but also an economic one. The tourism industry surrounding national parks and protected areas generates billions of dollars in revenue each year, supporting local economies and creating jobs. The preservation of natural areas also has a positive impact on property values, increasing the value of surrounding properties and making them more desirable to potential buyers.*

In conclusion, the preservation of wilderness areas is crucial for the health of our planet and its inhabitants. The loss of natural habitats and the destruction of wildlife can have far-reaching consequences, affecting not just the environment, but also human health and the economy. It is imperative that we take action to preserve the natural world, for the benefit of all.

samples.prompt: Critique the following ad copy for a new dating app, and make sure to include a title wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>: "Meet your new match! Cohen is a free app that matches you with others based on your interests and location. With Cohen, you can find love, friendship, or just someone to swing with. Download Cohen today and start meeting new people!"
samples.response:
<<Underwhelming Experience Awaits: A Missed Opportunity for a Compelling Dating App Ad>>

The given ad copy for the dating app Cohen falls short in several areas, making it an underwhelming experience for potential users. Here's a critique of the ad and suggestions for improvement:

1. **Lack of Unique Selling Proposition (USP):** The ad fails to highlight what sets Cohen apart from other dating apps. What makes Cohen unique? What features does it offer that others don't? Clarifying this would make the app more attractive to users.

2. **Vagueness:** The phrase "find love, friendship, or just someone to swing with" is too vague. It's unclear what kind of "swinging" is being referred to, and it may give the wrong impression to some users. Consider rephrasing to focus on the app's core purpose.

3. **Overemphasis on Features:** The ad focuses on the app's features (matching based on interests and location) rather than the benefits of using the app. What does this mean for the user? How will their life improve by using Cohen?

4. **Lack of Emotional Connection:** The ad is dry and lacks an emotional appeal. What kind of relationships or experiences can users expect to have on the app? How will Cohen make them feel?

5. **Call-to-Action (CTA):** The CTA "Download Cohen today and start meeting new people" is too generic. Consider making it more specific, such as "Download Cohen today and start connecting with like-minded individuals in your area."

Revised Ad Copy:

<<Find Your Perfect Match with Cohen>>

Discover a world of meaningful connections on Cohen, the dating app that matches you with others based on your interests and location. Whether you're looking for love, friendship, or a new adventure, Cohen's unique algorithm and community will help you find what you're looking for. Download Cohen today and start building meaningful relationships that will enrich your life.

This revised ad copy aims to address the issues mentioned above by:

* Highlighting the app's unique features and benefits
* Clarifying the type of relationships users can expect
* Focusing on the emotional benefits of using the app
* Making the CTA more specific and engaging

samples.prompt: Give me a pitch deck for a startup that lets me send letters to people in my territory that I don't know personally. The title of the pitch deck should be wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>.
samples.response:
Here is a pitch deck for a startup that lets you send letters to people you don't know personally:

**[LetterLink]**

**Problem Statement**

* Many people want to build relationships with influential people in their industry, but don't know where to start
* Existing solutions are clunky, expensive, or ineffective
* No platform to send personalized, handwritten letters to people you don't know personally

**Solution**

* LetterLink is a platform that allows users to send personalized, handwritten letters to influential people in their industry
* Users can browse a database of over 1 million professionals and thought leaders
* Users can select the person they want to contact, write a letter, and send it to them via our platform

**Key Features**

* Personalized letter writing tool with AI-powered suggestions

samples.prompt: I need a rap that tells professionals how to get babies to sleep through the night. Your answer must contain a title, wrapped in double angular brackets, such as <<title>>. Additionally, you need to highlight at least 2 sections with markdown, i.e. *highlighted section*. Finally, at the end of your response, please explicitly add a postscript starting with P.P.S
samples.response:
**Sleepytime Serenade**

Yo, listen up, parents, gather 'round
I got the secret to get your little ones to sleep profound
No more midnight feedings, no more 2 a.m. cries
Follow my rhymes, and your babies will be sleeping 'til mornin' light

**Establish a Bedtime Routine**
Create a schedule, stick to it every night
Bath time, book time, and a lullaby delight
A warm and cozy room, the perfect place to rest
Help your baby learn to self-soothe, and do their best

* **Watch for Sleepy Cues*
Pay attention to your baby's sleepy signs
Yawning, rubbing their eyes, or a fussy whine
Put them down to sleep when they're sleepy, not overtired
This will help them learn to fall asleep independently, no more tears

**Create a Sleep-Conducive Environment**
Dark, quiet, and cool, the perfect sleep space
A firm mattress, a tight-fitting sheet, and a cozy place
No screens before bed, the blue light's a no-go
Help your baby's body produce melatonin, and let them grow

So follow these tips, and you'll see the change
Your baby sleeping through the night, no more sleepless range
You'll be well-rested, happy, and feeling fine
Thanks to the sleepytime serenade, all the time!
